page.title: 07HOWIES EMPLOYMENT DUNLOP
page.content: AT PRESENT THE DUNLOP BRANCH OF THE FIRM EMPLOYS 240 MANUAL WORKERS AND 40 STAFF. THEY ARE THE LARGEST EMPLOYER IN THE AREA. MOST EMPLOYEES TRAVEL TO WORK DAILY FROM OUT OF DUNLOP, ONLY 20% OF THE WORK FORCE LIVE LOCALLY.THE WORK FORCE ARE EMPLOYED IN TIMBER, CONCRETE AND STEEL CONSTRUCTION, A HAULAGE BUSINESS, GRAIN MILL AND A POULTRY REARING HOUSE.THE FIRM OWNS A LIME QUARRY AT BEITH AND A LIME WORKS AT LUGTON. WELDERS, JOINERS , MECHANICS AND FITTERS ARE EMPLOYED. 2 APPRENTICES ARE TAKEN ON EACH YEAR FOR TRAINING. MANY EMPLOYEES JOIN THE FIRM AS APPRENTICES AND STAY WITH THE FIRM UNTIL THEY RETIRE. SOME OF THE EMPLOYEES LIVE IN TIED HOUSES BELONGING TO THE FIRM THOUGH THERE IS NO LONGER ANY NEED FOR THIS PRACTICE AS LOCAL AUTHORITIES CAN HOUSE THEM.
